content.description: A cart moves forward along a linear track that may or may not have varying heights above the ground. Starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </math>, the horizontal position of the cart along the track is marked at regular intervals of time, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The only forces that are exerted on the cart are from the track and Earth. Friction between the cart and the track is negligible.
content.question: Which of the following figures depict a track that could result in the motion indicated in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1</mn> </math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a cart moving to the right along a flat track that does not change in height.
The figure shows a cart moving to the right along a track that starts out horizontal, slopes downward, and ends horizontal at a height below the starting position.
The figure shows a cart moving to the right along a track that starts out horizontal, slopes upward, then slopes back downward, and ends horizontal at the same height as the starting position.
The figure shows a cart moving to the right along a track that starts out horizontal, slopes upward, and ends horizontal at a height above the starting position.

content.answer: The figure shows a cart moving to the right along a track that starts out horizontal, slopes upward, and ends horizontal at a height above the starting position.
